meanings.definition: The state of things as they actually exist, rather than as they may appear or might be imagined.
meanings.sent1: In the world of fairy tales, magic is common, but in the realties of everyday life, magic is rare.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the natural world to understand the realties of our universe.
meanings.sent3: When the magician's tricks failed to impress the audience, he had to face the realties of his limited skills.
meanings.sent4: The realties of the business world can be harsh, like a storm that sweeps away the weak.
meanings.sent5: The realties of poverty are often overlooked by those who have never experienced it firsthand.

meanings.definition: Real things or facts, as opposed to something that is imagined or invented.
meanings.sent1: In court, only the realties of the case matter, not the opinions of spectators.
meanings.sent2: Historians strive to uncover the realties of past events, not just the stories passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The child's imaginary friend disappeared when he learned to distinguish between realties and fantasies.
meanings.sent4: The realties of history are like puzzle pieces that fit together to reveal the bigger picture.
meanings.sent5: The realties of nature can be both beautiful and brutal, showing the true essence of life on Earth.
